MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: This category assesses the candidate's depth and breadth of technical skills relevant to the role, including experience with specific technologies, frameworks, and development methodologies.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's resume, portfolio (if available), and responses to technical interview questions. Verify certifications and assess hands-on coding skills through technical assessments or coding challenges.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of required technologies and development practices. Requires significant guidance and training.
Demonstrates basic proficiency in some key technologies but may lack experience in others. Needs moderate guidance.
Strong command of required technologies and development methodologies. Can independently contribute to projects and solve complex problems.
Expert-level proficiency in all required technologies and development practices. Can lead technical initiatives, mentor junior engineers, and innovate new solutions.

MainCategory.Description: Problem Solving and Analytical Skills: This category evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective and efficient solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with hypothetical technical challenges or real-world scenarios encountered in software development. Assess their ability to break down problems, articulate their thought process, and propose viable solutions. Observe their debugging skills.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to understand complex problems and develop effective solutions. Requires significant assistance.
Can analyze simple problems and propose basic solutions. May struggle with more complex scenarios.
Demonstrates strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Can independently identify and resolve complex issues.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities. Can identify and address critical issues proactively and develop innovative solutions.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration: This category assesses the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences, and to collaborate effectively with team members.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Observe the candidate's communication style during the interview. Assess their ability to clearly explain technical concepts and to actively listen to and understand others' perspectives. Evaluate their teamwork experience and ability to work in a collaborative environment.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Difficulty communicating technical information effectively. Struggles to collaborate with others.
Communicates technical information adequately but may struggle with complex explanations. Can collaborate effectively with guidance.
Communicates technical information clearly and concisely. Collaborates effectively with team members and contributes to a positive team environment.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills. Can effectively communicate with diverse audiences and build strong working relationships.

MainCategory.Description: Adaptability and Learning Agility: This category assesses the candidate's ability to adapt to changing technologies and requirements, and to learn new skills quickly and effectively.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about the candidate's experience with learning new technologies or adapting to changing project requirements. Assess their willingness to learn and their ability to quickly grasp new concepts. Discuss their professional development plans.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistance to change and difficulty learning new technologies. Requires significant support to adapt to new environments.
Willing to learn new technologies but may require some guidance. Adapts to change with moderate effort.
Adapts quickly to changing requirements and learns new technologies effectively. Demonstrates a proactive approach to professional development.
Exceptional adaptability and learning agility. Embraces new challenges and quickly masters new technologies and concepts.

MainCategory.Description: Experience: Assesses the depth and breadth of the candidate's relevant professional experience. Experience in public safety or public health software is a bonus. This comes from the Official JD.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Thoroughly review the candidate's resume, paying close attention to previous roles, responsibilities, and accomplishments. Verify the accuracy and relevance of their experience through reference checks and interview questions. Focus on relevant industries and technologies.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no relevant experience. Lacks foundational knowledge and practical skills for the role.
Some relevant experience but may lack depth in key areas. Requires some guidance and on-the-job training.
Solid and demonstrable relevant experience. Capable of independently handling most tasks and contributing effectively to projects.
Extensive and highly relevant experience. A proven track record of success in similar roles and industries.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality: Assesses the candidate's ability to write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples provided by the candidate (e.g., GitHub repository, portfolio). Assess the code for readability, adherence to coding standards, use of appropriate data structures and algorithms, and overall efficiency.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is difficult to understand and maintain. Lacks proper documentation and may contain significant inefficiencies.
Code is generally readable and maintainable but may contain some minor issues. Adheres to basic coding standards.
Code is clean, well-documented, and highly maintainable. Demonstrates a strong understanding of coding best practices.

SubCategory.Description: Testing and Debugging: Assesses the candidate's ability to write effective unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, and to debug code efficiently.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about the candidate's experience with different testing frameworks and methodologies. Assess their ability to write comprehensive test cases and to identify and fix bugs effectively. Discuss their debugging process.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited experience with testing and debugging. Struggles to write effective tests and to identify and fix bugs.
Some experience with testing and debugging. Can write basic tests and debug code with some guidance.
Strong understanding of testing and debugging principles. Can write comprehensive tests and debug code efficiently.

SubCategory.Description: System Design: Evaluates the candidate's ability to design and architect software systems that meet specific requirements and are scalable, reliable, and maintainable.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with a system design problem and ask them to propose a solution. Assess their ability to define system components, identify dependencies, and consider scalability, reliability, and security requirements. Evaluate their understanding of different architectural patterns.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited understanding of system design principles. Struggles to design even simple systems.
Some understanding of system design principles. Can design basic systems with some guidance.
Strong understanding of system design principles. Can design complex systems that meet specific requirements.

SubCategory.Description: Domain Knowledge: Assesses the candidate's knowledge of the specific industry or domain in which the software will be used. This comes from the Official JD.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about the candidate's experience with the specific industry or domain. Assess their understanding of the relevant business processes, regulations, and user needs. Evaluate their ability to apply their technical skills to solve domain-specific problems.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no knowledge of the specific industry or domain. Lacks understanding of relevant business processes and regulations.
Some knowledge of the specific industry or domain. Can apply their technical skills to solve basic domain-specific problems.
Strong understanding of the specific industry or domain. Can effectively apply their technical skills to solve complex domain-specific problems.

SubCategory.Description: Teamwork & Initiative: Assesses the candidate's teamwork skills and their ability to take initiative and responsibility. This comes from the Official JD and Candidate JD.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Inquire about their experience working in teams, their ability to handle conflicts, and their contributions to team projects. Use behavioral questions to gauge their proactiveness, problem-solving skills, and willingness to go the extra mile.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to work effectively in a team, avoids responsibility, and shows little initiative.
Works reasonably well in a team, takes on assigned tasks, and shows some initiative.
Excellent teamwork skills, proactively contributes to the team, takes ownership of tasks, and demonstrates a high level of initiative.
